T.CEETtT 1999
A
CATALOGUE
Of the Curious
COLLECTION
O F
COINS and MEDALS,
O F
Charles Woolfe, Efq;
Late of Haseley Court, in the
^Cpunty of Oxford,
AND OF
GEORGE COOKE, Efq;
Both iDeceas'D;
k
Which (by Order of the Executors)
Will be fold by A u c t i o n.
By Mr. Langford and Son,
At their Houle in the Great Piazza, Covent
Gardifiy
On Saturday the iSth of this Inftant February i ^69.
--
«
The laid Collection mav he viewed on Friday the 17th
InOant, and till the Time of Sale, which will begin
punctually at Twelve o'Clock.
Catalogues may be had gratis on the Days of Viewing,
at Mr. Lang ford's aforefaic.
text.preface:
Conditions of SALE.
1[ft,
B E higheft Bidder is to be the Buyers
j[ and if any Dilute fhall arife between
any two or more Bidders, the Lot fo difputed fhall
be immediately put up again, and refold.
2,dh\ No Perfon to advance lefs than 6d. under a
Bounds above a Pound u; above Five Pounds
2s 6d. and fo on in Proportion. %dly, The Purchasers are to give in their Names
and Places of Abode, and to pay down Five Shillings
in the Pound (if required) in Part of Payment of
the Purchafe Money \ in Default of which, the
Lot or Lots fo pur chafed, to be immediately put up
again and refold.
A*hly, The Lots fhall be fetched away with
all Faults, at the Buyer's Expence, within One
Day after the Sale
,
and the Remainder of the
Purchafe Money absolutely paid on or before
the Delivery.
Lajlly, Upon Failure of complying with the above Conditions, the Money fo depofited in Part of Pay
ment, fhall be forfeiteds the Lots uncleared within the
One as aforefaid, fhall be refold, by publick
or private Sale, and the Deficiency (if any) together
with all Charges attending fuch Ref ale t
fhall be made good by the Defaulters at this Sale*
